file_content.text: Enjoy your leave, Lieutenant. I'll meet you on Coruscant when you're ready for your next assignment.
Negative on hostiles!
It's all clear, General.
At ease, Lieutenant. You've done a truly remarkable job--congratulations.
I'm just glad it's over, sir.
Thank you very much.
As are we all, Lieutenant.
Here you go, General--one traitor, as ordered.
We got him.
Yes, I can see that. You've truly outdone yourself, Lieutenant.
Harron Tavus has been neutralized, General.
We got him.
Did you come to give me my medal in person?
Are you here to reward me?
You'll absolutely be rewarded for your success here, Lieutenant. But it can wait.
Hello, Harron. I wasn't sure we'd ever have another opportunity to speak. I'm pleased you've finally decided to cooperate.
I'm... I'm finished fighting, Garza. If the only way I can tell my story now is in a court-martial, then so be it.
A court-martial, Harron? That isn't the arrangement I expected you to suggest.
I don't really have a choice. I've lost everything that was worth fighting for.
The people of the Republic are still out there, Harron. They're the ones you should've been fighting for all along.
Team one: Take the prisoner back to our ship and secure him in the brig.
See you around, Tavus.
Goodbye.
Goodbye. Lieutenant.
He's one of ours, soldier--treat him right.
Take good care of him.
Understood, sir.
I want this traitor out of our sight.
Get him out of here.
Yes, sir!
Harron Tavus, dead. I honestly had to come just to see it for myself.
He was one of the best soldiers to ever serve under my command. It's a very great shame that he chose to end his career this way.
If I could've brought him in alive, General, I would have.
I'm sorry I had to kill him.
You did your duty. You have absolutely nothing to apologize for.
You had no way to predict this, General.
No one saw this coming.
If only I could have. So much time, so many resources, just to stop a man who was supposed to be on our side.
Tavus betrayed the Republic. He got what he deserved.
Treason is treason.
Yes. Yes, I'd say he did.
I congratulated you earlier, Lieutenant, but I think it bears repeating. You've accomplished something remarkable today.
Tavus and his followers knew every aspect of our organization. They could have torn the Republic military apart piece by piece--but they never got the chance. Thanks to you.
It's an honor to defend the Republic, General.
I just did my duty.
The Republic has little to fear, with soldiers like you to defend it.
I never would've pulled it off without Sergeant Jorgan.
I wasn't alone.
Thanks, Lieutenant. I'm glad I got the chance to help you hunt those traitors down.
I couldn't have done it without Sergeant Dorne's help.
I wasn't alone.
Thank you very much, Lieutenant. It's an honor to serve in Havoc Squad.
I never could've made it without Forex to back me up.
I wasn't alone.
You are too kind, sir! I have merely played my part in the defense of galactic freedom.
I had plenty of help along the way.
I wasn't always alone.
No question, but that does nothing to lessen what you've achieved.
That's why I'm the best.
We'll be staying to search the ship for intelligence while the hyperdrive is reactivated. But there's no need for you to remain, as well.
I'd say you've earned some leave, Lieutenant. Take some time off, then return to my office on Coruscant when you're ready to discuss a new assignment for Havoc Squad.
It will be nice to finally relax a bit.
Sounds like a plan.
Yes, I imagine it will.
May I ask what you have in mind for us, sir?
New assignment?
That will all come later. Don't worry.
No medals? No promotions?
Don't worry, we'll discuss the recognition of your exemplary service upon your return to Coruscant.
Now go out and enjoy yourself a bit, Lieutenant. And congratulations yet again on completing one of the most difficult assignments in SpecForce's history.
You're too kind, General.
Thank you very much.
If I am, you're the first person to think so.
Come on, Jorgan, let's go get a drink.
Let's have some fun.
I used to know a great cantina on Ord Mantell. It's probably a crater by now, though.
Ready to cut loose in some Nar Shaddaa casinos, Elara?
Let's have some fun.
I'll endeavor to enjoy myself wherever you choose to take us, sir.
Ready to take it easy for a while, Forex?
Let's have some fun.
I appreciate the invitation, sir, but I find happiness only in crushing the verminous enemies of freedom.
Maybe I'll see what Nar Shaddaa is like when you're not in the middle of a mission.
Time for some fun.
Could I get moving now?
Enjoy yourself, Lieutenant. Dismissed.
There's no time to waste, Lieutenant. Proceed to those coordinates as soon as you are able.
Welcome, Lieutenant. Stand at ease, make yourself comfortable. We have a great deal to discuss.
Before we begin, I want to congratulate you on everything you've achieved thus far. You've completed missions and defeated enemies that few other soldiers could ever contend with.
I'm glad I could make a difference.
Thank you, General.
You've certainly done that--and you aren't even finished.
It was nothing, really.
You've gone far beyond the call of duty, Lieutenant.
I'll gladly accept the rank of captain.
Promotion time.
You've done some excellent work, Lieutenant. But don't get ahead of yourself.
The time has come to end this--to deal with your former squad-mates' treachery once and for all.
We've made a critical breakthrough in the search for Tavus. A decisive opportunity has presented itself. Are you ready to end this, Lieutenant?
I'm always ready.
Yes, sir, General.
Good.
What's going on?
The last "opportunity" turned out to be an ambush.
You better be sure this time.
That possibility will always exist, but I'm confident that the information we've discovered is genuine.
We've intercepted a signal broadcast to Taris, Nar Shaddaa, Tatooine and Alderaan.
The signal contained a message from Tavus, calling for all of his surviving followers to pull out and rendezvous in Imperial space.
Do we have the coordinates for the rendezvous?
Where, exactly?
Yes. They were included in the signal.
I thought I had wiped those traitors out.
Tavus still has followers?
Apparently, some number of scattered survivors remained behind on the worlds you visited.
Another hidden rendezvous in the middle of nowhere? We're falling for this again?
Sounds like the perfect trap.
You can proceed as cautiously as you like, Lieutenant. But we are going to act on this intelligence.
I suspect the Empire is losing its patience with Tavus. Every operation the Havoc traitors were involved in has now been completely obliterated.
Your missions have been very costly for the Empire. I think Tavus is trying to regroup before the Imperials cut him off completely.
If Tavus is pulling back, this would be a good time to make a move.
Sounds like an opportunity.
Exactly what I was thinking, Lieutenant.
It's nice to know I've made an impact.
That's what I like to hear.
We're only just beginning.
You can't know any of this for sure, General.
This is all guesswork.
No, but I know what I'd do if I were in the same situation.
I want you to infiltrate Tavus's rendezvous. You'll proceed to the coordinates in the message and slip in amongst the surviving traitors to board his vessel.
What's the plan once I'm aboard, sir?
And then?
A little infiltrate, a little assassinate... count me in.
Sounds fun.
You're dreaming.
I'm confident that infiltrating the ship will end up being the easiest part of the mission, Lieutenant.
Once on board, your first objective will be disabling the ship's hyperdrive.
Next comes your ultimate objective: Tavus. Locate and neutralize him with extreme prejudice, Lieutenant.
Tavus won't escape us this time, General.
Understood.
I'm going to enjoy taking that traitor down.
It will be a pleasure.
This all assumes I manage to stay alive for longer than five seconds.
If I survive, you mean.
I wouldn't be sending you if I didn't think you were capable of this, Lieutenant.
You don't need me to tell you the kind of odds you'll be facing out there....
This is no ordinary mission. This is a Havoc mission. A mission no other unit could ever accomplish. Is Havoc Squad prepared to do what no one else can, Lieutenant?
Havoc Squad is willing and able, General!
Affirmative, sir!
You'd better believe it.
It doesn't sound like we have much of a choice either way.
I hope so.
The choice between fighting for the Republic or ignoring our duty to protect its citizens is no choice at all.
Here--get yourself and your people the best load-outs you can. Then head for the rendezvous coordinates.
I'm counting on you, Lieutenant. The Republic is counting on you. So get out there and do us proud. Dismissed.
Welcome, Lieutenant.
I think you may be looking for a different office.
